page.title: 08Marchington Indust. Estate
page.content:
This recently opened industrial estate occupies the site of a former army camp built in the 1940's. Although it covers 72 acres (29 hectares) its opening has made little impact on the community.
In addition to warehousing there are many smaller units including one which produces printed circuit boards for computers and another which repairs mining cables.
The site includes the largest single site grain store in Europe, with grain worth several million pounds.
A walk around the now empty barracks takes one back in time to the days when they were a bustling community.
